text: Richard Oliver Earnshaw (8 January 1939 - 28 July 1963) was an English first- class cricketer. While undertaking his National Service in the Royal Electrical and Mechanical Engineers, Earnshaw played first-class cricket for the Combined Services cricket team, making his debut against the touring South Africans at Portsmouth in 1960. He made a second first-class appearance in 1961, against Northamptonshire at Northampton. He scored 11 runs across his two matches, as well as bowling 67 wicketless overs with his right-arm fast- medium bowling, conceding 211 runs. He died at Westminster in July 1963, aged just 24. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1939 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Huddersfield Category:Royal Electrical and Mechanical Engineers soldiers Category:English cricketers Category:Combined Services cricketers
title: Richard Earnshaw
